description:
**Problem**
Phase 5 tests need a mock replication peer and network simulation.

**Context**
- REALTIME_PLAN.md ยง18: replication ACK/WANT behavior, backpressure
- Blocks Phase 5 testing bead

**Design**
Create test infrastructure:
- Mock replication peer: accepts connections, sends/receives frames
- Channel-based transport for in-process testing (no real TCP)
- Network simulator: inject delays, drops, reordering
- Frame builders for HELLO, WELCOME, EVENTS, ACK, WANT, PING, PONG
- Backpressure trigger helpers (fill ingest queue to limit)

**Acceptance**
- [ ] tests/fixtures/repl_peer.rs with MockPeer
- [ ] tests/fixtures/repl_transport.rs with ChannelTransport
- [ ] tests/fixtures/repl_frames.rs with frame builders
- [ ] MockPeer can complete handshake and exchange events
- [ ] cargo test fixtures::repl passes

**Files:** tests/fixtures/repl_peer.rs (new), tests/fixtures/repl_transport.rs (new), tests/fixtures/repl_frames.rs (new)
title: Phase 5 test infrastructure: mock peer + network simulator

description:
**Problem**
Replication snapshots are deferred in v0.5, so large catch-up relies on checkpoints. We do not stress or validate checkpoint-based bootstrap under high churn.
design:
**Design**
- Add a slow e2e that generates large WALs + checkpoints, then brings up a fresh node and verifies catch-up via checkpoints + WAL tail.
- Assert bounded convergence time and correct watermarks/heads after bootstrap.
title: Realtime: checkpoint bootstrap under churn
Fix config path override init ordering and runtime env fallback

description:
**Problem**
`handle_list` and `handle_count` both build `Filters` manually with overlapping fields and similar trimming logic. The duplication makes it easy for behavior to drift (e.g., title/label handling) and adds cognitive overhead when updating filter semantics.

**Design**
Introduce a small CLI helper to construct `Filters`:
- Add a helper (e.g., `filters_from_list_args`, `filters_from_count_args`, or a `FiltersBuilder`) in `src/cli/mod.rs` or a new `src/cli/filters.rs`.
- Move common normalization (status, priority, bead_type, assignee, labels, search text, parent) into shared code.
- Keep command-specific fields (e.g., time ranges for count) in their respective handlers.

**Design Notes**
This is a refactor only; do not change behavior. Preserve exact parsing and validation error messages.

**Acceptance**
- [ ] `handle_list` and `handle_count` use shared `Filters` construction for common fields.
- [ ] CLI filter behavior remains unchanged.
- [ ] Run `codex review --uncommitted` (timeout 10m) and address findings.
- [ ] Tests pass.

**Files:** `src/cli/mod.rs`, `src/cli/commands/list.rs`, `src/cli/commands/count.rs`
title: Consolidate CLI Filters building
